Node.definition: = man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= process by which someone is going to die, described as a movement in one way only
= all of the people born and living at about the same time

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= process by which the sun appears in the morning to provide light and warmth to the world; ≈ associated with a new period of well being
= process by which humans or animals strain for breath with an open mouth, ◄ caused by exhaustion or pain
= process by which the sun appears in the morning to provide light and warmth to the world; ≈ associated with a new period of well being
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
= a cardinal direction to the right of a person facing the sunrise
= action by which humans, supernatural beings, forces of nature, or other objects face a direction different from the one they were facing before
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= action by which humans, supernatural beings, forces of nature, or other objects face a direction different from the one they were facing before
= action by which humans, supernatural beings, forces of nature, or other objects face a direction different from the one they were facing before
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
literally: to turn (back) to (an activity); hence: = action by which humans engage in an activity; in most cases this is an activity in which they were engaged before

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
literally: to turn (back) to (an activity); hence: = action by which humans engage in an activity; in most cases this is an activity in which they were engaged before
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
= state in which humans have lost their strength as a result of laborious work which requires a lot of energy, either physically or mentally

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process by which someone's desire finds relief
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: to be done; hence: = process by which certain events take place without observers always having a clear understanding of who is the agent
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to be done; hence: = process by which certain events take place without observers always having a clear understanding of who is the agent

= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time, sometimes including an element of surprise
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= process by which humans retain knowledge of people from the past, or of things that have happened in the past
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= process by which humans retain knowledge of people from the past, or of things that have happened in the past
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans or deities make an intensive effort to obtain in depth information about a certain object or event
literally: to spy out; hence: = action by which humans increase their knowledge by processing a large quantity of information
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: to be done; hence: = process by which certain events take place without observers always having a clear understanding of who is the agent

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans are physically and mentally preoccupied with a responsibility or task ◄ often assigned to them by God

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: to be done; hence: = process by which certain events take place without observers always having a clear understanding of who is the agent
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
literally: striving after wind; hence: = action by which humans are actively looking to be engaged in activities that serve no purpose

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= process by which something becomes bent or twisted out of shape or position

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= state in which an object extends uniformly in one direction only, without a curve or bend; ≈ associated with just behavior
= something that is absent in a context where it is supposed to be present

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative process by which a deity causes events to increase in intensity
literally: to add; hence: = process by which a certain quality of humans increases in intensity, either in actual fact or in the eyes of others
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to know; hence: = action by which humans exercise their minds with regards to a certain matter so that they will know what to do
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which an action is regarded as abnormal and associated with people who are insane
